title: Start
message: To begin the annotation process - press the "START" button.

title: Highlighting
message:
Choosing aligning spans is done by highlighting them.
To do that, click the first word and hold it until all the span is covered (the covered span will be colored orange to guide you).

title: Un-Highlighting
message: To un-highlighting: hold the ctrl key (for windows) or the alt key (for MacOS) and highlight the relevant span in the same manner described in the previous section.

title: Work Sentence-by-Sentence
message: You will work one summary sentence at a time, and you won't be able to proceed to the next sentence before highlighting all the current sentence. To help you focus, the current sentence will be mark by red box.

title: Confirm Alignments
message: When you are satisfied with an alignment, press the "CONFIRM" button. Doing so will save the alignment (its color will be changed to a faded yellow).

title: Bold - Full Sentence
message: To help you find the alignments, document words related to the current summary sentence will be in bold.

title: Bold - Span
message:
When a summary span is chosen (highlighted), the bolding narrows down to words related to the highlighted summary span, to help you better focus.
For example, the bolding helps us see that the currently highlighted span is aligned to a part of the first sentence, and to another span further along.

title: Bolding Control
message:
In addition to the default behavior, you can also control the bolding level you prefer, through the red slider at the top-right corner of the screen.
you can alter between:
  • No bolding (leftmost)
  • Currently highlighted span bolding (middle)
  • Current sentence bolding (rightmost)

title: Single Word Hint
message:
If you want to find document words related to a specific summary word, without turning off the bolding option, hover over it.
This will "activate" the related document words (turn them red).

title: Old Alignments
message:
Every alignment which is approved, is saved and can be seen with a faded-yellow background.
You can control how many of the old alignments to see, by toggling the blue slider adjacent to the bolding-control slider.
You can alter between:
  • No previous alignments (leftmost)
  • Only Current sentence's previous alignments (middle)
  • All previous alignments (rightmost)

title: Revise
message:
If at any given point you regret one of your old alignments, you have the option to revise it.
To do that:
  1. hit "REVISE" to enter revision mode.
  2. Hover over the old alignments to find the one you want to fix (when hovered over, the alignments will "unfade" to guide you).
  3. Click the Alignment you want to fix.
  4. Fix it.
  5. If you are satisfied, press "CONFIRM". Alternatively, if you regret, press "BACK" to discard all your changes.
You can do steps 2-5 multiple times.
When you are satisfied with all your revisions, press "EXIT REVISION" to leave the revision mode and return to the normal annotation mode.

title: End of Sentence
message:
Once you highlighted a full sentence, you will automatically be prompted to proceed to the next sentence.
Clicking the "NEXT SENTENCE" button will save the currently chosen alignment and will proceed to the next sentence.

title: Submit
message:
Once you are finished highlighting the summary, you will be prompted to submit your work.
Clicking the "SUBMIT" button will save your last alignment and submit your whole work.

title: Unalignable Spans
message:
Rarely there would be pieces of information in the summary that wouldn't have any alignment in the document.
In such cases, highlight the piece of information and submit it unaligned (with the document highlighting-free).
Notice that the "CONFIRM" button appears with "NO ALIGN" and in a different color (the same applies for the "NEXT SENTENCE" and the "SUBMIT" buttons).
Doing this will prompt a pop-up message asking if you are sure this span is un-alignable.
